channel.title: Run32 or Run64-both give errors
channel.description: So this may sound stupid but I'm not sure if I have a 64 bit or a 32 bit computer. I'm 90% sure I have a 32 bit so when I run it it says... Could not find the main class: jframe. Program will exit. It's obviously there though.... So when I run64 it says [code=java]The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .[/code] Now i'm almost positive the class and classpath are set up right because I can run a server. So if you have any idea on how to fix this please respond, or you can try to help by Teamviewing me. Just send pm or add my MSN Tactical_gmodz@hotmail.com Thanks, Tyler

item.title: Run32 or Run64-both give errors
item.dc:creator: @i_fail_serv i fail serv
item.description:
@i_fail_serv wrote:

Go. Control panel --> system. and then you will see what you computer it’s 32 bit or 64. and
if you are on 32bit you don’t need edit the Run if you are on 64bit. you need the edit run.bat and show your run code.

Read full topic

item.title: Run32 or Run64-both give errors
item.dc:creator: @ibarageu ibarageu
item.description:
@ibarageu wrote:

So this may sound stupid but I’m not sure if I have a 64 bit or a 32 bit computer. I’m 90% sure I have a 32 bit so when I run it it says…
Could not find the main class: jframe. Program will exit. It’s obviously there though…
So when I run64 it says

The system cannot find the path specified. Press any key to continue . . .
Now i’m almost positive the class and classpath are set up right because I can run a server. So if you have any idea on how to fix this please respond, or you can try to help by Teamviewing me. Just send pm or add my MSN Tactical_gmodz@hotmail.com
Thanks, Tyler

Read full topic
